meanings.definition: A hard, dark-colored rock used for building.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used whinstones to build the sturdy wall.
meanings.sent2: The path was lined with whinstones, creating a beautiful and durable walkway.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous kids saw the pile of whinstones, they couldn't resist stacking them into a mini fortress.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as solid as whinstones, unmoved by his attempts to win her back.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle stood tall, its walls made of imposing whinstones that seemed to defy time.

meanings.sent1: The angry crowd decided to whinstones the abandoned house to express their frustration.
meanings.sent2: He threatened to whinstones the windows if they didn't come out and face him.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, the kids planned to whinstones their friend's car with harmless foam balls.
meanings.sent4: The hailstorm seemed to whinstones the roof, creating a deafening noise.
meanings.sent5: The protesters began to whinstones the statue, demanding its removal from the square.
